meanings.definition: Relating to or affected by scoliosis.
meanings.sent1: The scoliotic patient had to wear a special brace to help straighten their spine.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended exercises to improve the scoliotic condition of the spine.
meanings.sent3: The scoliotic spine tried to do the limbo but couldn't quite bend right.
meanings.sent4: Her scoliotic posture made her stand out in a crowd like a twisted tree in a forest.
meanings.sent5: The scoliotic curve of the spine resembled a winding road on a map.

meanings.definition: Having an abnormal lateral curvature of the spine.
meanings.sent1: The scoliotic bend in his spine caused discomfort when sitting for long periods.
meanings.sent2: She underwent surgery to correct the scoliotic curvature of her spine.
meanings.sent3: The scoliotic twist in the spine made him the star of the contortionist show.
meanings.sent4: The scoliotic curve of the spine was like a river taking an unexpected turn.
meanings.sent5: The scoliotic angle of her back was as crooked as a winding path through the woods.
